intro: Leucas nepetifolia, commonly known as blue hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular and often have a strong, sweet scent. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
